intro: Hieracium langei, commonly known as the Lange's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium langei is relatively small, usually reaching heights of no more than 30 centimeters.
